Tutorial

The mainmenu

Setup your menu like you normally would, using UL, LI and A elements:

<ul>
   <li><a href="/">Home</a></li>
   <li><a href="/about/">About us</a></li>
   <li><a href="/contact/">Contact</a></li>
</ul>

Make sure to wrap the text in either an A or a SPAN element.


Wrap it in a node

Wrap the entire UL in a node (for example a NAV element) and give that node an ID:

<nav id="my-menu">
   <ul>
      <li><a href="/">Home</a></li>
      <li><a href="/about/">About us</a></li>
      <li><a href="/contact/">Contact</a></li>
   </ul>
</nav>

It is not important where in the HTML the NAV is, so you can use the same HTML for your desktop website (where you probably don't use the mmenu-plugin).


Not a menu

If you're using the plugin for purposes other than a menu, simply don't use an UL element.
